text: Any word on when adding class names to DND sections - either by predetermined choice select or by text-field, will be coming to the content editor? :partyparrot: :pray: :pray: :pray: :pray:
Also, being able to specify that the section is a real <section> or an <article> would be nice too.

<@UDHT6N5SM> I think this is a cool idea but do you think that most individuals adding content to pages are aware of HTML Semantics to that degree? I kind of feel like that might just be adding features for us devs but to content editors might be confusing and make the experience a bit more confusing as well.

Definitely needs more thought. Iâ€™m currently exploring different ways of putting together templates. At the moment, it feels like code heavy templates up front become less and less useful as edits are made to the website page itself and modules become more adaptable. I think if we invest in better module options then we can avoid throwing away template code. Maybe the option could be locked or hidden? Maybe user roles get involved?
